oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Remington revolver dug from Spring Hill, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Model 1858 Remington revolver recovered from Spring Hill, Williamson County, Tenn. The cylinder is missing as are the wooden grips. The Remington was second only to Colt in the numbers of revolvers provided to the Union Army.; During the Civil War there were several skirmishes around Spring Hill and a large battle was fought there on November 29, 1864. The Confederate cavalry commanded by Earl Van Dorn and Nathan Bedford Forrest camped there in the spring of 1863.
